can change and savings can disappear it happens all the time one example of dozens could share couple was married living in small apartment and sharing one car so they could save up for down payment on house they had two young children both planned both well cared for she stayed home he worked her husband company was sold to another company and his entire division got laid off without warning he continued to work part time contract jobs until he found something full time he found new job that seemed perfect the only catch was that insurance wouldn kick in for 90 days but he would be back to making full time income and they still had about 6000 saved so they probably be ok if anything went wrong week into the new job his appendix ruptured emergency surgery recovery etc the hospital bill was 35000 and they would not negotiate on top of that other bills started rolling in ambulance 3500 anesthesiologist etc it felt unending he had an infection that complicated recovery and missed so much work that the new job let him go not sure if that was legal but with the stress of being sick and having two kids and all this debt he couldn fight it the wife went and got job but it didn pay nearly what her husband had been making she could cover rent and the car but nothing else her husband got better and the economy took dump now work was harder to find and what he could find didn pay much so what do you do you cut back everything you can you get on food stamps you try to be responsible and keep going and sometimes that means getting down to only three diapers before you get paid
